page.title: 05Blaenpant Mansion
page.content: Blaenpant Mansion was originally built in the 17th Century by the Bristocke family who were wine importers. The estate extended to 2,000 acres but many farms e.g. Scotland and Bailey were sold to the tenants in the 1920's. The Brigstocke family also owned Cardigan Island. In 1972 Blaenpant mansion which was farmed by Mrs R J James was sold to Mr & Mrs D Arnott and the land to Messrs James, Garden House Farm. The frontage is still part o he original building although other parts have been renovated. Mr & Mrs Arnott run a flourishing antiques Restoring business from Blaenpant. It was built for a daughter after she returned from a school in Switzerland to remind her of that country. It's a Swiss Chalt and had falen into ruin until it was restored by Dr Little.
